title: Welcome to the Hyperion Forum: Our Community Home
content:
Welcome to the Hyperion Forum – our shared space where builders, investors, and users come together to learn, collaborate, and shape the Hyperion ecosystem.
What You’ll Find Here
Connect & Learn Together
Community Updates – Find out what’s happening across our ecosystem
Upcoming Features – Learn about what’s being built and how you can contribute
Meet Fellow Members – Connect with others who share your interest in Hyperion
Contribute & Grow Together
Share Your Knowledge – Every quality post and thoughtful reply helps others and builds our community
Recognition – Active participants are valued and recognized for their contributions
Make Connections – Find collaborators and friends who share your interests
Note: To keep our space helpful for everyone, we don’t allow spammy behavior or low-value contributions
How Our Forum is Organized
Houses
Coming soon after launch
Think of our Houses system like the houses at Hogwarts in Harry Potter – a friendly competition with teams that share values and work together. With a special twist: when anyone in your House wins a major competition (like a prize in the hackathon), the most active members of that House ALSO win rewards!
Note: The Houses section may not be included in the initial forum launch, but we’re excited to introduce this feature soon.
Guilds
Specialized communities for those driving Hyperion forward:
Builders Guild – For developers creating the applications of tomorrow
Marketers Guild – For those spreading the word about Hyperion’s capabilities
Operators Guild – For those maintaining and scaling the infrastructure
Announcements
Stay informed with the latest:
Thought Leadership – Deep insights into the technology and its implications
News – Official updates from the core team
Launch Announcements – Be first to know about new projects in the ecosystem
Starter Kit
Everything you need to get up to speed:
Resources – Documentation, guides, and tutorials
How-to’s – Step-by-step instructions for common tasks
Support – Get help from experienced community members
HyperHack
The ongoing Hyperion hackathon:
Challenges – Specific problems seeking innovative solutions
Teams – Find collaborators or track progress of existing teams
Submissions – Explore projects being built on Hyperion
Prizes – Details on rewards for top contributors
What We’re Building Together
Hyperion is a Layer 2 solution we’re developing as a community, designed to support AI applications and high-performance needs. Some key features include:
Fast Transactions – Making interactions smooth and responsive
AI Support – Creating space for new types of applications
Low Fees – Keeping costs accessible for everyone
Technical Improvements – Working to make everything run better behind the scenes
Come Join Us
This forum is a place where we come together to discuss ideas, help each other, and build something meaningful.
Everyone’s welcome, and everyone’s contribution matters.
Getting started is easy:
Introduce yourself in the welcome thread
Complete your profile with a photo and description of your interests and skills
Find the topics that interest you and jump into the conversation
The more we know about you, the better we can connect you with opportunities and fellow members who share your interests. We’re looking forward to getting to know you!
We can’t wait to see your profile and welcome you to our community!

title: Stay Up-to-Date with Hyperion Campaign Events - Add to Your Calendar!
content:
Hey everyone,
Want to easily keep track of all the exciting events related to the Hyperion Campaign? You can now add the official Hyperion Campaign Events calendar directly to your own calendar app! This way, you’ll get notifications and reminders so you never miss out.
How to add the calendar to your device:
For Google Calendar Users (Android & Web):
Open your Google Calendar app or go to https://calendar.google.com in your browser.
On the left sidebar, find the “Other calendars” section (you might need to click the “+” icon next to it).
Select “From URL.”
In the “Calendar URL” field, paste the following link: https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=c_4261e08b7076baf12d50be3c1338e19a2aa96288b168a7d1a146f5b67b895e5c%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=America%2FToronto
Click “Add calendar.” The “Hyperion Campaign Events” calendar will now appear in your list of calendars.
For Apple Calendar Users (iOS & macOS):
On iPhone/iPad:
Open the “Calendar” app.
Tap “Calendars” at the bottom.
Tap “Add Calendar” (or “Add Calendar Subscription…”).
Select “Subscribe to Calendar…”
In the “Calendar URL” field, paste the following link: https://calendar.google.com/calendar/ical/c_4261e08b7076baf12d50be3c1338e19a2aa96288b168a7d1a146f5b67b895e5c%40group.calendar.google.com/public/basic.ics
Tap “Subscribe.”
You can then customize the calendar name and color. Tap “Done.”
On macOS:
Open the “Calendar” app.
Go to “File” > “New Calendar Subscription…”
In the “Calendar URL” field, paste the following link: https://calendar.google.com/calendar/ical/c_4261e08b7076baf12d50be3c1338e19a2aa96288b168a7d1a146f5b67b895e5c%40group.calendar.google.com/public/basic.ics
Click “Subscribe.”
You can then customize the calendar name and color. Click “OK.”
Once you’ve added the calendar, you’ll automatically see Hyperion Campaign events in your schedule and receive notifications according to your calendar app’s settings.
Stay engaged and don’t miss any of the action!

title: Invite Reward System: Quality Matters
content:
We’re launching an invite system to grow our community with valuable contributors.
How It Works:
Each member can generate unique invite links through your profile settings
Use the “Create Invite Link” here or in the navigation bar at the left
Share your link with people who will add value to our discussions
We track who joins through your invites
Rewards & Consequences
Members who bring in active, positive contributors will receive rewards
Quality matters more than quantity
Inviting users who contribute thoughtfully earns you recognition
Inviting users who never participate or post low-quality content counts against you
Deliberately inviting bots or spam accounts may result in account suspension
What We Value
Contributors who engage meaningfully in discussions
Members who share knowledge and respectful perspectives
People who follow our community guidelines
If your invitees don’t engage or post low-quality content, this reflects poorly on you. Bringing in 100 users who never post or get removed will harm your standing rather than help it.
Questions? Reply directly to this post!

title: Badge and Point System User Guide
content:
Metis Hyperion Forum Badge and Point System Guide
Metis New Forum is designed as an interactive space for innovators, builders, and community members to connect, collaborate, and contribute to the future of AI-focused Layer 2 technology. Whether you’re a developer, investor, or enthusiast, this is your chance to actively participate in shaping Hyperion’s growth and evolution.
Earn Rewards by collecting Points and Badges
The more you contribute, the more you gain! Our badge and point system ensures active participants are rewarded for their hard work. From weekly leaderboards to special badges (Gold, Silver, and Bronze), there are plenty of ways to be recognized.
In the Hyperion Forum, there are two ways to be recognized and earn rewards:
Points are earned through daily activities like posting, commenting, and engaging with others. You’ll be rewarded regularly, and the leaderboard will showcase top contributors weekly.
Badges are special achievements that recognize your milestones within the community. Badges are grouped into four categories based on specific actions:
Getting Started: 17 badges
Community: 20 badges
Posting: 9 badges
Trust Level: 4 badges
Each category will feature a combination of Gold, Silver, and Bronze badges, so you can earn recognition based on different actions in the forum.
Gold: 10 badges
Silver: 12 badges
Bronze: 28 badges
Total: 50 badges
You will earn badges by:
Engaging in discussions
Sharing valuable resources
Joining guilds and supporting the Hyperion ecosystem
Participating in HyperHack to showcase your innovative projects
Note: All points earned within the Hyperion Forum during the campaign period will be tracked and accumulated. At the conclusion of the Hyperion campaign, these points will be redeemable for future rewards within the Metis ecosystem. Details regarding the specific rewards and the redemption process will be announced at the end of the campaign. This ensures that your contributions and engagement throughout the Hyperion initiative are recognized and rewarded in a meaningful way.
Point breakdown
Action Description Point
Like received score value The value of the cheer awarded when a user receives a like 1
Like gave score value The value of the cheer awarded for every like a user gives 1
Solution score value The value of the cheer awarded when a user’s post is marked as a solution 10
User invited score value The value of the cheer awarded when a user has an invite redeemed 10
Time read score value The value of the cheer awarded for every hour of time spent reading 1
Post read score value The value of the cheer awarded for every one hundred posts a user reads 1
Topic created score value The value of the cheer awarded when a user creates a topic 5
Post created score value The value of the cheer awarded when a user creates a post 2
Flag created score value The value of the cheer awarded, a user flags a post and flag is accepted by a staff user 10
Day visited score value The value of the cheer awarded for every day a user visits the site 1
Reaction received score value The value of the cheer awarded when a user receives a reaction 1
Reaction gave score value The value of the cheer awarded for every reaction a user gives 1
Chat reaction received score value The value of the cheer awarded when a user receives a reaction to a chat message 1
Chat reaction gave score value The value of the cheer awarded for every reaction a user gives to a chat message 1
Chat message created score value The value of the cheer awarded for every message a user sends in a chat 1
Badge explainer table:
# Badge Category Badge Name Tier Short description Explainer
1 Getting Started Autobiographer Bronze Filled out profile information This badge is granted for filling out your user profile and selecting a profile picture. Letting the community know a bit more about who you are and what you’re interested in makes for a better, more connected community. Join us!
2 Getting Started Certified Bronze Completed our new user tutorial This badge is granted upon successful completion of the interactive new user tutorial. You’ve taken the initiative to learn the basic tools of discussion, and now you’re certified!
3 Getting Started Editor Bronze First post edit This badge is granted the first time you edit one of your posts. While you won’t be able to edit your posts forever, editing is encouraged ‚ so you can improve the formatting, fix small mistakes, or add anything you missed when you originally posted. Edit to make your posts even better!
4 Getting Started First Emoji Bronze Used an Emoji in a Post This badge is granted the first time you add an Emoji to your post. Let you convey emotion in your posts, from happiness to sadness to anger and everything in between. Just type or press the Emoji toolbar button in the editor to select from hundreds of choices
5 Getting Started First Flag Bronze Flagged a post This badge is granted the first time you flag a post. Flagging is how we all help keep this a nice place for everyone. If you notice any posts requiring moderator attention, please don’t hesitate to flag. If you see a problem, flag it!
6 Getting Started First Like Bronze Liked a post This badge is granted the first time you like a post using the heart button. Liking posts is a great way to let your fellow community members know that what they posted was interesting, useful, cool, or fun. Share the love!
7 Getting Started First Link Bronze Added a link to another topic This badge is granted the first time you add a link to another topic. Linking topics helps fellow readers find interesting related conversations by showing the connections between topics in both directions. Link freely!
8 Getting Started First Mention Bronze Mentioned a user in a post This badge is granted the first time you mention someone’s @username in your post. Each mention generates a notification to that person, so they know about your post. Just begin typing @ (at symbol) to mention any user or, if allowed, group - it’s a convenient way to bring something to their attention.
9 Getting Started First Onebox Bronze Posted a link that was onboxed This badge is granted the first time you post a link on a line by itself, which automatically expanded into a onebox with a summary, title, and (when available) picture.
10 Getting Started First Quote Bronze Quoted a post This badge is granted the first time you quote a post in your reply. Quoting relevant parts of earlier posts in your reply helps keep discussions connected together and on topic. The easiest way to quote is to highlight a section of a post, and then press any reply button. Quote generously!
11 Getting Started First Reply By Email Bronze Replied to a post via email This badge is granted the first time you reply to a post via email.
12 Getting Started First Share Bronze Shared a post This badge is granted the first time you share a link to a reply or topic using the share button. Sharing links is a great way to show off interesting discussions with the rest of the world and grow your community.
13 Getting Started New User of the Month Bronze Outstanding contributions in their first month This badge is granted to congratulate two new users each month for their excellent overall contributions, as measured by how often their posts were liked, and by whom.
14 Getting Started Read Guidelines Bronze Read the community guidelines This badge is granted for reading the community guidelines. Following and sharing these simple guidelines helps build a safe, fun, and sustainable community for everyone. Always remember there’s another human being, one very much like yourself, on the other side of that screen. Be nice!
15 Getting Started Reader Bronze Read every reply in a topic with more than 100 replies This badge is granted the first time you read a long topic with more than 100 replies. Reading a conversation closely helps you follow the discussion, understand different viewpoints, and leads to more interesting conversations. The more you read, the better the conversation gets. As we like to say, Reading is Fundamental!
16 Getting Started Wiki Editor Bronze First wiki edit This badge is granted the first time you edit one wiki post.
17 Getting Started Licensed Silver Complete our advanced user tutorials This badge is granted upon completing the interactive advanced user tutorial successfully. You’ve mastered the advanced tools of discussion ‚ and now you’re fully licensed!
18 Community Appreciated Bronze Received 1 like on 20 posts This badge is granted when you receive at least one like on 20 different posts. The community is enjoying your contributions to the conversations here!
19 Community Enthusiast Bronze Visited 10 consecutive days This badge is granted for visiting 10 consecutive days. Thanks for sticking with us for over a week!
20 Community Nice Share Bronze Shared a post with 25 unique visitors This badge is granted for sharing a link that was clicked by 25 outside visitors. Thanks for spreading the word about our discussions and this community.
21 Community Out of Love Bronze Used 50 likes in a day This badge is granted when you use all 50 of your daily likes. Remembering to take a moment and like the posts you enjoy and appreciate encourages your fellow community members to create even more great discussions in the future.
22 Community Promoter Bronze Invited a user This badge is granted when you invite someone to join the community via the invite button on your user page, or at the bottom of a topic. Inviting friends who might be interested in specific discussions is a great way to introduce new people to our community, so thanks!
23 Community Thank You Bronze Has 20 liked posts and gave 10 likes This badge is granted when you have 20 liked posts and give 10 or more likes in return. When someone likes your posts, you find the time to like what others are posting, too.
24 Community Welcome Bronze Received a like This badge is granted when you receive your first like on a post. Congratulations, you’ve posted something that your fellow community members found interesting, cool, or useful!
25 Community Aficionado Silver Visited 100 consecutive days This badge is granted for visiting 100 consecutive days. That’s more than three months!
26 Community Anniversary Silver Active member for a year, posted at least once This badge is granted when you’ve been a member for a year with at least one post in that year. Thank you for sticking around and contributing to our community. We couldn’t do it without you.
27 Community Campaigner Silver Invited 3 basic users This badge is granted when you’ve invited 3 people who subsequently spent enough time on the site to become basic users. A vibrant community needs a regular infusion of newcomers who regularly participate and add new voices to the conversations.
28 Community Gives Back Silver Has 100 liked posts and gave 100 likes This badge is granted when you have 100 liked posts and have gave 100 or more likes in return. Thanks for paying it forward!
29 Community Good Share Silver Shared a post with 300 unique visitors This badge is granted for sharing a link that was clicked by 300 outside visitors. Good work! You’ve shown off a great discussion to a bunch of new people and helped this community grow.
30 Community Higher Love Silver Used 50 likes in a day 5 times This badge is granted when you use all 50 of your daily likes for 5 days. Thanks for taking the time to actively encourage the best conversations every day!
31 Community Respected Silver Received 2 likes on 100 posts This badge is granted when you receive at least 2 likes on 100 different posts. The community is growing to respect your many contributions to the conversations here.
32 Community Admired Gold Received 5 likes on 300 posts This badge is granted when you receive at least 5 likes on 300 different posts. Wow! The community admires your frequent, high-quality contributions to the conversations here.
33 Community Hyper Gold Invited 5 members This badge is granted when you’ve invited 5 people who subsequently spent enough time on the site to become full members. Wow! Thanks for expanding the diversity of our community with new members!
34 Community Crazy in Love Gold Used 50 likes in a day 20 times This badge is granted when you use all 50 of your daily likes for 20 days. Wow! You’re a role model for encouraging your fellow community members!
35 Community Devotee Gold Visited 365 consecutive days This badge is granted for visiting 365 consecutive days. Wow, an entire year!
36 Community Empathetic Gold Has 500 liked posts and gave 1000 likes This badge is granted when you have 500 liked posts and have gave 1000 or more likes in return. Wow! You’re a model of generosity and mutual appreciation
37 Community Great Share Gold Shared a post with 1000 unique visitors This badge is granted for sharing a link that was clicked by 1000 outside visitors. Wow! You’ve promoted an interesting discussion to a huge new audience and helped us grow our community in a big way!
38 Posting Nice Reply Bronze Received 10 likes on a reply This badge is granted when your reply gets 10 likes. Your reply made an impression on the community and helped move the conversation forward.
39 Posting Nice Topic Bronze Received 10 likes on a topic This badge is granted when your topic gets 10 likes. You started an interesting conversation that the community enjoyed.
40 Posting Popular Link Bronze Posted an external link with 50 clicks This badge is granted when a link you shared gets 50 clicks. Thanks for posting a useful link that added interesting context to the conversation!
41 Posting Good Reply Silver Received 25 likes on a reply This badge is granted when your reply gets 25 likes. Your reply was exceptional and made the conversation much more interesting.
42 Posting Good Topic Silver Received 25 likes on a topic This badge is granted when your topic gets 10 likes. You started an interesting conversation that the community enjoyed.
43 Posting Hot Link Silver Posted an external link with 300 clicks This badge is granted when a link you shared gets 300 clicks. Thanks for posting a fascinating link that drove the conversation forward and illuminated the discussion!
44 Posting Famous Link Gold Posted an external link with 1000 clicks This badge is granted when a link you shared gets 1000 clicks. Wow! You posted a link that significantly improved the conversation by adding essential detail, context, and information. Great work!
45 Posting Great Reply Gold Received 50 likes on a reply This badge is granted when your reply gets 50 likes. Wow! Your reply was inspiring, fascinating, hilarious, or insightful and the community loved it!
46 Posting Great Topic Gold Received 50 likes on a topic This badge is granted when your topic gets 50 likes. You kicked off a fascinating conversation and the community loved the lively discussion that resulted!
47 Trust Level Leader Gold Granted global edit, pin, close, archive, split and merge, more likes This badge is granted when you reach trust level 4. You’re a leader in this community as selected by staff, and you set a positive example for the rest of the community in your actions and words here. You have the ability to edit all posts, take common topic moderator actions such as pin, close, unlist, archive, split, and merge.
48 Trust Level Basic Bronze Granted, all essential community functions This badge is granted when you reach trust level 1. Thanks for sticking around and reading a few topics to learn what our community is about. New user restrictions have been lifted; you’ve been granted all essential community abilities, such as personal messaging, flagging, wiki editing, and the ability to post multiple images and links.
49 Trust Level Member Bronze Granted invitations, group messaging, and more likes This badge is granted when you reach trust level 2. Thanks for participating over a period of weeks to truly join our community. You can now send invitations from your user page or individual topics, create group personal messages, and have more likes per day.
50 Trust Level Regular Silver Granted, recategorize, rename, followed links, wiki, more likes This badge is granted when you reach trust level 3. Thanks for being a regular part of our community over a period of months. You’re now one of the most active readers and a reliable contributor who makes our community great. You can now recategorize and rename topics, take advantage of more powerful spam flags, and you’ll also get lots more likes per day.

title: Meet Hyperion: The Next Big Thing in Layer 2 Scaling (And Why Devs Should Care!)
content:
Exciting news for builders and AI enthusiasts! Metis just unveiled Hyperion, a groundbreaking Layer 2 solution designed to redefine scalability and empower AI-native dApps. Let’s break down why this is a game-changer:
Hyperion: Next-Gen Layer 2 Architecture
MetisVM: AI-Optimized Powerhouse
Hyperion’s Metis Virtual Machine (MetisVM) is custom-built for on-chain AI inference and high-throughput dApps. With dynamic opcode optimization, speculative parallel execution, and state-aware caching, MetisVM slashes gas fees and boosts processing speeds, enabling developers to run machine learning models directly on-chain.
Parallelized Transactions for Hyper-Scalability
Hyperion’s Parallel Execution Engine, paired with an Optimistic Rollup model, processes multiple transactions simultaneously, delivering sub-second finality. Optimized fraud-proof mechanisms ensure security without sacrificing speed, making Hyperion perfect for real-time AI, gaming, and DeFi applications.
MetisDB: Revolutionizing Storage
MetisDB eliminates storage bottlenecks with memory-mapped Merkle Trees, multi-version concurrency control, and asynchronous I/O processing. This ensures lightning-fast data access and cost-efficient state management, critical for data-intensive AI applications.
Seamless Ethereum and Cross-Chain Integration
Hyperion commits state changes to Ethereum for battle-tested security while enabling cross-chain liquidity through a shared bridge framework. Integration with off-chain compute networks allows AI developers to leverage distributed processing power, creating scalable, interoperable dApps.
Decentralized Sequencing for Fairness
Hyperion’s Decentralized Sequencer Network, with leader rotation, timeout failover, and MEV-resistant ordering, eliminates censorship risks and single points of failure. This ensures fair, reliable transaction processing, aligning with blockchain’s core principles.
Why it’s built for AI-native dApps？
MetisVM provides foundational support for on-chain AI applications through:
Inference Engine Optimization: Ensures AI models can run efficiently on the blockchain.
AI Coprocessor Acceleration: Utilizes hardware accelerators like SIMD, GPU, TPU, and FPGA.
zkVM Integration: Enables zero-knowledge proofs for AI inference processes.
AI Contract Template Library: Pre-configured with over 20 industry-standard model interfaces.
Hybrid Development Environment: Supports mixed-programming in multiple languages.

title: CVP Proposal: Star Protocol – Omni-chain Name Service Provider Launching .metis
content:
Introducing the Metis Omni-chain Domain Name System ‘.metis’
Star Protocol is an omni-chain name service provider currently deployed on 29 networks with over 370,000 unique wallet addresses using their existing omni-chain name service. The following information outlines their approach for launching a Metis domain name system.
.metis Top-Level Domain Launch
While the Star Protocol operates on Metis network already, allowing cross-chain compatibility for existing domain holders, Star proposes the launch of an official Metis DNS. This initiative involves introducing an updated .metis top-level domain.
Universal Identity Layer on Metis
Recent proliferation of web3 DNS has resulted in fragmented systems across Layer 1 (L1) and Layer 2 (L2) networks, lacking interoperability and omni-chain compatibility.
Using Layer Zero technology, Star protocol seamlessly interacts across multiple blockchain networks, ensuring its compatibility with a wide spectrum of DNS applications. This cross-chain capability not only extends the reach of the protocol’s services but also fosters a more interconnected and comprehensive community.
With over 500,000 registrations and 370,000+ active wallet addresses, Star’s extensive reach highlights its significance within the evolving web3 ecosystem.
Leveraging Network of Partners.
Star Protocol will leverage the technical capabilities of Consensys, given their existing partnership through the Scale Accelerator program. Combined with the distribution effects of their 282 partnerships within the L1 & L2 network ecosystem. Leading to increased exposure and utility of .metis on supported dApps across multiple networks.
Unique characteristics of Star Protocol
Advanced omni-chain interoperability: Employs an interconnected DNS to facilitate a streamlined user experience across Web3.
Omni-chain resolution API: Streamlining DNS integration into Metis dApps for omni-chain resolution to abstract 0x hash addresses and facilitate send/receive functionality.
End-to-end TLD registration, management, UI & UX design: A dedicated website for the Metis DNS will be created. The Star team will establish a unique X/Twitter Channel, a Discord space, and customized roles for .metis holders. This setup will coordinate campaigns with various Metis ecosystem projects. Moreover, a specialized business development team and budget will oversee .metis operations.
Dedicated network of partners Star Protocol will leverage Consensys’ technical capabilities and our 282 L1 & L2 network partnerships to boost .metis exposure and utility on dApp integrations like Syncswap & Dmail.
Preview
Live UI example for Star’s existing Kroma Network DNS; https://kromans.domains (Updated based on design & branding guidelines of Metis Network)
Platform Diagram
Audit Report: Completed by Secure3.io (Founders of CertiK) > Secure3Academy/audit_reports/StarEvm at main · Secure3Audit/Secure3Academy · GitHub
The Benefits to Metis Network
Star’s proposal aims to enhance the user experience on the Metis Network by implementing an omnichain name service that leverages distribution affects of the existing Star ecosystem.
Benefits to user; Enabling necessary infrastructure for Metis network identity solutions. In the form of personal DID’s and unique web3 user names for .metis holders to improve user experience within the Metis ecosystem.
Benefit to Metis ecosystem projects; Seamless integration with an omni-chain API combined with Improved user onboarding and retention by leveraging name resolution directly into user interfaces within project dApps.
Integration Examples
Wallet - Abstract away 0x hash address to resolve ‘.metis’ TLD. Send/receive directly to the ‘.metis’ TLD
Explorer - Resolve names on the Metis blockchain explorer replacing all 0x hash addresses of domain holders.
Marketplace - Enable ‘.metis’ domain holders to trade their domains.
Roadmap
‘.Metis’ registration and management (Phase 1)
UI website design and integration with support for multiple Web3 wallets. (Phase 2) Wallets Currently Supported; Metamask, OKX Web3, Bitkeep, C98 Super Wallet
Cross-chain bridge integration with LayerZero Labs (Phase 3)
Metis Native/3rd Party Integrations; Explorer & Wallets (Phase 3)
Reward System Integration (Phase 4)
NFT Marketplace listing for trading .Metis domains. Can be incorporated with the native/3rd party marketplace first and then into the Star Name Service Omnichain Marketplace later) (Phase 4)
Summary
Star Protocol proposes to deploy an omnichain name service on the Metis network with the .metis TLD with live launch scheduled for as soon as the Metis communities approve the respective governance proposals.

title: YieldMaximizer: AI-Powered DeFi Yield Optimization via Telegram
content:
Project Name
YieldMaximizer: AI-Powered DeFi Yield Optimization via Telegram
Problem Statement
Crypto asset holders struggle to identify and execute optimal lending/borrowing strategies across multiple DeFi platforms, missing significant yield opportunities. Manual management is time-consuming, error-prone, and requires constant vigilance as interest rates fluctuate across platforms. This complexity creates a significant barrier to maximizing returns, especially for non-technical users.
Solution Overview
YieldMaximizer is an intelligent AI agent system that automates yield optimization across multiple DeFi lending platforms through a familiar Telegram interface. The system continuously monitors market conditions, identifies optimal strategies including recursive lending/borrowing loops and cross-platform arbitrage, and executes them based on user-defined risk parameters. This approach democratizes sophisticated yield farming techniques previously available only to experienced DeFi power users. The implementation is designed to be protocol-agnostic and can adapt to work with available DeFi protocols like Uniswap v3 and Compound v2 forks, potentially pivoting to LP providing strategies when needed.
Project Description
YieldMaximizer revolutionizes DeFi yield optimization by bringing institutional-grade strategies to retail users through Telegram’s accessible interface. The system employs multiple specialized AI agents working in concert to analyze market conditions, identify opportunities, and execute complex multi-step transactions.
Core features include the “Loop Amplification” engine that creates recursive lending-borrowing loops on single platforms, “Bridge Maximization” for cross-protocol arbitrage, and dynamic risk-adjusted positioning that continuously recalibrates based on changing conditions. The system leverages Model Context Protocol (MCP) technology (with our own MCP server for certain components) and the Alith framework to maintain coherent understanding across interactions, remembering user preferences, portfolio composition, and past decisions without requiring users to repeat information.
While initially designed for lending/borrowing platforms, the system architecture is flexible enough to optimize liquidity positions across Uniswap v3 pools with different fee tiers and concentration ranges if traditional lending protocols aren’t available. The core AI agent infrastructure remains valuable for identifying optimal strategies regardless of the specific DeFi protocols in the ecosystem.
Users connect their wallets through secure WalletConnect integration, set their risk preferences, and receive personalized strategy recommendations with projected APY directly in chat. The system then monitors positions 24/7, providing alerts and implementing automatic rebalancing when market conditions change. All of this happens through a natural, conversational interface that explains complex strategies in accessible terms tailored to each user’s demonstrated technical understanding.
What makes this project particularly exciting is how it removes significant barriers to DeFi adoption while promoting capital efficiency across the ecosystem, all through a messaging app that billions of people already have installed.
Community Engagement Features
Strategy Discovery (50 points): Users connect their wallet and complete the risk preference questionnaire to receive their first personalized strategy recommendation.
First Position Deployment (100 points): Users approve and execute their first yield strategy, demonstrating the seamless transaction flow.
Cross-Platform Arbitrage (75 points): Users activate a Bridge Maximization strategy that spans multiple lending platforms or liquidity pools.
Strategy Optimization (50 points): Users adjust their risk parameters and observe how the system recalibrates their positions.
Referral Program (25 points per referral): Users earn points by inviting others to the platform, with bonus points when referred users deploy their first strategy.
Yield Milestone Achievements (variable points): Users unlock badges and points when their strategies reach specific yield thresholds.
This gamification approach creates clear milestones for users to achieve, encouraging deeper platform engagement while simultaneously educating them about DeFi concepts. The points system provides instant gratification for completing actions that benefit both the user and the platform ecosystem.

Joining our Telegram channel at Telegram: View @gmetisio

title: Why metis
content:
Metis (METIS) distinguishes itself in the crowded field of Ethereum Layer 2 (L2) solutions through a combination of advanced technology, robust infrastructure, and a strong focus on decentralization and developer empowerment. Here’s why Metis stands out:
Advanced Layer 2 Technology
Optimistic Rollups: Metis employs Optimistic Rollups to bundle and process transactions off-chain, significantly reducing gas fees and increasing throughput while maintaining Ethereum’s security standards.
Decentralized Sequencer Network: Unlike many L2s that rely on centralized sequencers, Metis introduces a decentralized sequencer pool, enhancing fairness and resistance to censorship.
Metis Hyperion (HYPE): This next-generation infrastructure is optimized for high-performance applications, including AI, DeFi, and gaming, offering real-time transaction processing and near-instant finality.
Developer-Centric Ecosystem
Metis Virtual Machine (MVM): Fully compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), MVM allows developers to deploy existing Ethereum-based dApps with minimal modifications, facilitating a seamless transition.
Polis Middleware: Metis provides tools like Polis for managing decentralized autonomous companies (DACs), enabling structured governance and streamlined operations for decentralized organizations.
Native NFT Support: The platform offers an NFT bridge and storage solutions, allowing for efficient minting and transfer of NFTs between Ethereum and Metis, thereby reducing costs and enhancing accessibility.
Comprehensive Ecosystem and Governance
Decentralized Autonomous Companies (DACs): Metis introduces DACs as an evolution of DAOs, providing a framework for decentralized businesses with built-in governance and operational tools.
Community Engagement: Through initiatives like task-based airdrops and Layer3 Quests, Metis encourages active participation, rewarding users for engaging with the ecosystem and contributing to its growth.
METIS Token Utility
Staking and Governance: METIS tokens are used for staking by network validators and for participating in governance decisions, ensuring that token holders have a say in the platform’s development.
Transaction Fees: The token serves as the primary medium for paying transaction fees within the Metis network, incentivizing its use and circulation.
Incentive Mechanisms: METIS tokens are also utilized to reward users and developers, fostering a vibrant and active community around the platform.
